And, <S%G2532><s%> behold, <S%G2400><s%> there was <S%G2258><s%> a certain <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G444><s%> before <S%G1715><s%> him <S%G846><s%> which had the dropsy. <S%G5203><s%>

And <S%G2532><s%> they all <S%G3956><s%> with <S%G575><s%> one <S%G3391><s%> consent began <S%G756><s%> to make excuse. <S%G3868><s%> The <S%G3588><s%> first <S%G4413><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> unto him, <S%G846><s%> I have bought <S%G59><s%> a piece of ground, <S%G68><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> I must <S%G2192><s%> needs <S%G318><s%> go <S%G1831><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> see <S%G1492><s%> it: <S%G846><s%> I pray <S%G2065><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> excused. <S%G3868><s%>

For <S%G1063><s%> I say <S%G3004><s%> unto you, <S%G5213><s%> That <S%G3754><s%> none <S%G3762><s%> of those <S%G1565><s%> men <S%G435><s%> which were bidden <S%G2564><s%> shall taste <S%G1089><s%> of my <S%G3450><s%> supper. <S%G1173><s%>

Or else, <S%G1490><s%> while the other <S%G846><s%> is <S%G5607><s%> yet <S%G2089><s%> a great way off, <S%G4206><s%> he sendeth <S%G649><s%> ambassadors, <S%G4242><s%> and desireth <S%G2065><s%> conditions <S%G3588><s%> of <S%G4314><s%> peace. <S%G1515><s%>

Salt <S%G217><s%> is good: <S%G2570><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> salt <S%G217><s%> have lost his savor, <S%G3471><s%> wherewith <S%G1722><s%> <S%G5101><s%> shall it be seasoned? <S%G741><s%>

It is <S%G2076><s%> neither <S%G3777><s%> fit <S%G2111><s%> for <S%G1519><s%> the land, <S%G1093><s%> nor yet <S%G3777><s%> for <S%G1519><s%> the dunghill; <S%G2874><s%> but men cast <S%G906><s%> it <S%G846><s%> out. <S%G1854><s%> He that hath <S%G2192><s%> ears <S%G3775><s%> to hear, <S%G191><s%> let him hear. <S%G191><s%>
